result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan P Blaser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathan P Blaser is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathan P Blaser was found guilty of Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 7/13/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

IN CUSTODY 08:43 AM Defendant Jonathan P Blaser in court with attorney Jacob A Idlas. Prosecuting Atty Lexie Keyes appeared for State of Wisconsin.      Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 


On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count 2.


Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 1  
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for   3 years 

CONDITIONS:

-Serve 5 months  in the Dane County Jail, w/huber, to commence f/w 
-Court authorizes transfer to Lafayette County Jail
-No contact with: Courtney T-N.
-Ban from Epic Campus
-DNA on file
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Continue with Mental Health Treatment if required
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct 1
-DNA surcharge waived
-All other CC due on probation



-Days credit for time already served:  103 days
-Days credit if revoked: 103 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights
